intro: Crotalaria sapinii subsp. sapinii, commonly known as the mountain cowpea, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of South America. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and compound leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in temperate to subtropical climates. It is known for its ability to fix atmospheric nitrogen, making it beneficial for soil fertility. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
